'''Swalot''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''マルノーム''' ''Marunoom'') is a {{type|Poison}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Gulpin}} starting at [[level]] 26.

==Biology==
Swalot is a tall, purple, amorphous Pokémon. It has red, beady eyes and yellow whiskers. A female Swalot has shorter whiskers than a male. It has puckered lips and can fit an automobile tire in its mouth. Its hands have three fingers. It has a single row of black rhombi running across its midsection, and can expand and contract its body at will. It is capable of swallowing anything whole, and can digest anything except its own stomach lining. It covers prey and opponents with powerful poison. It lives in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Grassland Pokémon|grassy areas.}}

==In the anime==
[[File:Reggie Swalot.png|left|thumb|220px|Swalot in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
Swalot debuted in ''[[AG122|Deceit and Assist]]''. The Poison Bag Pokémon belonged to a {{pkmn|Coordinator}} named {{OBP|Anthony|AG122}}, who used it to compete in the [[Grand Festival]].

In ''[[AG127|From Brags to Riches]]'', a Trainer named [[Dominick]] used his Swalot and {{p|Tropius}} in a battle against {{Ash}}. They battled against {{AP|Corphish}} and {{AP|Torkoal}}, and Corphish managed to defeat Swalot.

[[Paul]]'s brother, [[Reggie]], owns a Swalot, which appeared in ''[[DP066|Lost Leader Strategy!]]''. Reggie used Swalot in his battle against Ash, where it battled against {{AP|Staravia}} and was able to defeat it.

===Minor appearances===
A Swalot that was painted to look like a {{p|Grimer}} was shown at the [[Pokémon Dress-Up Contest]] in ''[[DP033|All Dressed Up With Somewhere To Go!]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Swalot appeared in ''[[XY039|Summer of Discovery!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Swalot Adventures.png|thumb|200px|Swalot in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
Unlike its {{p|Gulpin|pre-evolution}}, Swalot has only made one key appearance in the [[Pokémon Adventures]] manga, being one of the Factory Pokémon fighting [[Pike Queen Lucy]] and [[Palace Maven Spenser]] in ''[[PS304|Swanky Showdown with Swalot]]''. Although it seemingly won using a {{m|Hyper Beam}} after putting the former's {{TP|Lucy|Seviper}} to sleep, the serpent awoke using its {{a|Shed Skin}} ability and counterattacked with a {{m|Dig}} maneuver, defeating it.

Swalot was selected as an enemy Pokémon for the [[Frontier Brain]]s' demonstration battle in ''[[PS304|Swanky Showdown with Swalot]]'', alongside {{p|Electrode}}, which represents author [[Hidenori Kusaka]].

The Battle Factory rented a Swalot which was stolen by [[Guile Hideout]] in ''[[PS334|The Final Battle VII]]''.

Later, a member of the [[International Police]] was shown to have a Swalot in ''[[PS528|Innocent Scientist]]'', also alongside an Electrode.

[[Team Flare Grunt (Trainer class)|Team Flare]] owns multiple Swalot, which first appeared in ''[[PAXY26|Rhyhorn Charges]]''.

The illustrator of Pokémon Adventures from [[Pokémon Adventures volume 10|Volume 10]] onwards, [[Satoshi Yamamoto]], is represented by a Swalot.

==Trivia==
*Swalot is the only Pokémon with a base stat total of 467.
===Origin===
Swalot's appearance may be based on a single, giant poison gland. Swalot might be based upon a generic organism that uses {{wp|pseudopodia}}.

====Name origin====
Swalot may be a combination of ''swallow'' and ''a lot''.

Marunoom may be a combination of 丸呑み ''marunomi'' (swallowing whole) and <!--kanji/katakana?-->''nomu'' (swallow or gulp).
